abstract: Lawyer for Angelika Graswald, who is accused of killing her fiance Vincent Viafore during kayaking trip on Hudson River, criticizes medical examiner's office for concluding  that it was homicide without any real medical evidence; autopsy report, in unusual elaboration, stated that kayak drain plug was intentionally removed.
lead_paragraph: The lawyer for the woman accused of killing the kayaker, Vincent Viafore, said the Orange County, N.Y., medical examiner had overstepped in reaching that conclusion. Some legal experts agree.

headline.main: Autopsy Cites ‘Intentionally Removed’ Plug in Ruling Kayaker’s Death a Homicide
headline.print_headline: ‘Intentionally Removed’ Plug Cited in Ruling Kayaker Death a Homicide

snippet: The lawyer for the woman accused of killing the kayaker, Vincent Viafore, said the Orange County, N.Y., medical examiner had overstepped in reaching that conclusion. Some legal experts agree.
